name: places/ChIJ08MopaZYwokRV0in0IvxHe4
formattedAddress: 2 E 93rd St, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2 E 93rd St, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text:
After 5 procedures done, I can say I am very happy I came to Dr. Elizabeth Harrington and her staff to get the surgeries I needed done. My legs have never felt this good and I receive a great and accommodating service.

She is very knowledgeable and can foresee any issues that could come up regarding vascular problems. Everything was addressed and fixed.

Not sure why this practice has received so many mixed reviews because from day one I have received the best service and care possible.

originalText.text: I had a terrible terrible experience with Dr. Harrington. Performed vascular surgery my on leg. I had procedure couple months ago. I have pain all over my leg and it’s getting worst. She didn’t explain me good about procedure. She just put needle on my leg with shaking her hand.  she is too old to performed vascular surgery. I am so regretting to see doctor like her because she messed up my leg. so please people read my review before you enter this office. Please Go somewhere else don’t go here.  I am writing this review because I don’t wanna other people suffer like I am now. Hope this review help others.

originalText.text: Did an excellent job on my AAA surgery and follow-ups.

text.text: Did an excellent job on my AAA surgery and follow-ups.

originalText.text: I didn’t feel like Dr Harrington was confident about recommending what I should do with my problem.  That’s number one but I feel equally important  is that you want your patients to feel comfortable when they visit you.  Dr. Harrington‘s practice environment (decor, cleanliness and staff professionalism) did not inspire in me a sense of pride in her practice. Her office decor is quite old, outdated and downright filthy. The walls were dirty and had  multiple repair patches on them,  the paint was old and chipping, and the door of my exam room had a large overt hole in it. I am a medical professional myself and would be embarrassed to bring my patients into that  setting.

originalText.text: I want to say that Dr. Elizabeth Harrington is a wonderful person who cares for her patients. I haven't seen her for at least 4 years and when she saw me she called me by my name.  I am sure she have thousands of patients but to remember me bought tears to my eyes. Love you Dr. Elizabeth Harrington for remembering me and your staff is amazing.
